TEI.2.document_title: Stephen F Austin to Toby and Brother, 11-19-1836

barker_notes.barker_citation: Eugene Barker, ed., The Austin Papers, (Austin: University of Texas Press, 1927), 3 vols., Vol 3, pp. 456-457

div1.p: Messrs Toby and Brother. New Orleans,

There are various little articles, which are indispensable in the Offices of the different Departments, and the impossibility of obtaining them here is my apology for troubling you with them. You would oblige me by procuring such as are enumerated in the subjoined list, and having them directed to the Department of State, Columbia. An early attention to this request will relieve the Government from much inconvenience.

p.person_mentioned: S. F. Austin Sec of State

div1.p: These 3 large and well Lettered on the Back. Letter Book Department of State etc. etc. ruled, but not crossed, longitudinally—
4 Blank books Lettered Department of State
1/2 doz. small blank books for mem. accts. etc.
2 Reams of superfine light blue letter paper.
Sealing Wax and wafers, a good supply Black lead pencils and quills—
3 Cards of best quality steel pens—
Stamp with a star in it
4 Sandboxes and a good supply of sand.
Regulations of the U. S. in relation to the four Departments of State, Treasury, War and Navy.
Story on the Constitution of the United States
Form Book, containing such forms as are used in the U. S. for Civil Commissions, Credentials and other State Documents—Land Laws of the U. S.
2. Large trunks for the safety of the public archives—
1 Piece of green baize for table covers, etc.—
Silk and wrapping paper; convenient quantity of each—
